DOC.brief_summary: The objective study investigate effect Lactobacillus Delbruckii lactis ( DN111244 ) ferment milk consumption relative change plasma LDL-cholesterol concentration hypercholesterolaemic adult 8 week product consumption versus control product .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Lactobacillus Delbruckii Lactis DN111244 Fermented Milk Consumption Plasma Lipids Levels Hypercholesterolaemic Adults
DOC.criteria: male female age 1875 year ; BMI 19 30 kg/m2 , LDLcholesterol plasma level 130 mg/dL 190 mg/dL ( bound include ) without statin monotherapy , stabilize hypercholesterolemia ( since 3 month ) , accept follow dietary recommendation advisable hypercholesterolemic patient ( NCEPATP III guideline ) , use consume dairy product , female : effective contraceptive method use , agree write informed consent plasma triglyceride ( TG ) level > 350 mg/dL ( 4 mmol//L ) , cardiovascular event ( infarction , angina , surgical endocoronary intervention , stroke , peripheral arteriosclerosis , etc ) last 6 month , know allergy hypersensitivity milk protein , systemic treatment topical treatment likely interfere evaluation study parameter , subject currently involve clinical trial exclusion period follow participation another clinical tria , subject situation investigator 's opinion could interfere optimal participation present study could constitute special risk subject , diabetic subject ( type I type II ) , kind disease likely interfere evaluation efficiency safety product , female subject : pregnancy , breast feeding intention become pregnant study , female subject : subject likely change contraceptive method study , active heavy cigarette smoker ( report 20 cigarette / day ) , subject actively participate weight loss program participate weight loss program three month prior screen study
